required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase II Study of Florbetaben (BAY94-9172) PET Imaging for Detection/Exclusion of Cerebral β-amyloid.
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Non-Randomized Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of BAY94-9172 (ZK 6013443) Positron Emission Tomography (PET) for Detection of Cerebral ß-Amyloid in Individuals With Down Syndrome Compared to Individuals Without Down Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the sensitivity of the visual assessment of BAY94-9172 PET images in detecting cerebral β-amyloid in individuals with Down Syndrome (DS) and specificity in individuals without DS. Given that individuals with Down Syndrome develop β-amyloid pathology over the age of 40, the clinical diagnosis of Down Syndrome will serve as the standard of truth.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of the Independent Visual Assessment of Detecting Cerebral Amyloid-beta in Individuals With Down Syndrome and Specificity in Subjects Without Down Syndrome
primary_outcome.description: The primary variables are sensitivity (percentage of DS subjects positive for cerebral beta-amyloid) and specificity (percentage of healthy volunteers negative for cerebral beta-amyloid) of brain uptake of florbetaben based on the majority read of the visual assessment by three independent blinded readers of PET images obtained 100 to 120 minutes post-injection of florbetaben.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity Results in the Down Syndrome Age Subgroups
secondary_outcome.description: The majority read sensitivity (percentage of DS subjects positive for cerebral beta-amyloid by majority read) was computed for the group of DS subjects with age equal to or below the median age (DS-young) and for DS subjects with age above the median age (DS-old). The median age was 46 yrs, with 3 subjects being exactly 46 yrs old. As defined, these subjects were assigned to the DS-young group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantitative Parameters Standard Uptake Value Ratio
secondary_outcome.description: The Standard Uptake Value Ratios for florbetaben signal in the frontal cortex, posterior cingulate, lateral temporal cortex, parietal cortex, and cerebellum (white matter) were determined as a quantitative measure of tracer uptake. The SUV is defined as the ratio of (1) the tissue radioactivity concentration c (in MBq/kg) at time point t, and (2) the injected activity (in MBq, extrapolated to the same time t) divided by the body weight (in kg). These SUV numbers from regions of interest were then used to derive SUV ratios (SUVR) using the SUV from the cerebellar cortex as reference.

secondary_outcome.measure: Consistency Between Visual and Quantitative Efficacy
secondary_outcome.description: For a comparison of the results of the visual assessment with the quantitative assessment, descriptive Standardized Uptake Value Ratio (SUVR) statistics were computed separately for DS subjects with an abnormal/normal majority read of the PET scan (DS-PET+/DS-PET-). The SUV is defined as the ratio of (1) the tissue radioactivity concentration c (in MBq/kg) at time point t, and (2) the injected activity (in MBq, extrapolated to the same time t) divided by the body weight (in kg). These SUV numbers from regions of interest were then used to derive SUV ratios (SUVR) using the SUV from the cerebellar cortex as reference.

intervention.description: 300 megabecquerels (MBq) as single IV injection of 2 to 10 mL

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Study participants were individuals with DS and healthy volunteers (HVs).
- Main inclusion criteria for individuals without DS
- >=21 and <= 40 years of age
- Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) >= 28
- Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) of 0
- Main inclusion criteria for individuals with DS
- >= 40 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Main exclusion criteria for both groups
- Unstable medical or psychiatric condition, study specific screening procedures with the understanding that the patient has the right to withdraw from the study at any time

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at two sites in the US.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 130 subjects were screened. 21 subjects were considered as screen failures and were not enrolled into the study. 9 subjects did not meet the inclusion/exclusion criteria. 10 subjects withdrew their consent. 1 subject was lost to follow-up and 1 subjected exceeded the weight limit for the camera.

group.title: Down Syndrome Group
group.description: 39 Down Syndrome subjects received Florbetaben (BAY94-9172) : 300 megabecquerels (MBq) single IV injection of 2 to 10 mL

group.title: Healthy Volunteer Group
group.description: 70 healthy volunteer subjects received Florbetaben (BAY94-9172): 300 MBq single IV injection of 2 to 10 mL

baseline.population: All Down Syndrome subjects and healthy volunteers enrolled into the study were included in the Baseline Analysis Population

group.title: Subjects Enrolled in Study
group.description: All Down Syndrome and healthy volunteer subjects

outcome.title: Sensitivity of the Independent Visual Assessment of Detecting Cerebral Amyloid-beta in Individuals With Down Syndrome and Specificity in Subjects Without Down Syndrome
outcome.description: The primary variables are sensitivity (percentage of DS subjects positive for cerebral beta-amyloid) and specificity (percentage of healthy volunteers negative for cerebral beta-amyloid) of brain uptake of florbetaben based on the majority read of the visual assessment by three independent blinded readers of PET images obtained 100 to 120 minutes post-injection of florbetaben.
outcome.population: All subjects in the down syndrome population and healthy volunteers were included in this analysis.

group.title: Majority Read
group.description: Majority read of the visual assessment made by 3 independent readers of PET images from all subjects.

measure.title: Sensitivity of the Independent Visual Assessment of Detecting Cerebral Amyloid-beta in Individuals With Down Syndrome and Specificity in Subjects Without Down Syndrome
measure.description: The primary variables are sensitivity (percentage of DS subjects positive for cerebral beta-amyloid) and specificity (percentage of healthy volunteers negative for cerebral beta-amyloid) of brain uptake of florbetaben based on the majority read of the visual assessment by three independent blinded readers of PET images obtained 100 to 120 minutes post-injection of florbetaben.
measure.population: All subjects in the down syndrome population and healthy volunteers were included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Sensitivity Results in the Down Syndrome Age Subgroups
outcome.description: The majority read sensitivity (percentage of DS subjects positive for cerebral beta-amyloid by majority read) was computed for the group of DS subjects with age equal to or below the median age (DS-young) and for DS subjects with age above the median age (DS-old). The median age was 46 yrs, with 3 subjects being exactly 46 yrs old. As defined, these subjects were assigned to the DS-young group.
outcome.population: All Down Syndrome subjects (n=39) were analyzed for this outcome.

group.title: Majority Read (DS-Young)
group.description: Majority Read results for Down Syndrome subjects with age <= 46 yrs

group.title: Majority Read (DS-Old)
group.description: Majority Read results for Down Syndrome subjects with age >46 yrs

measure.title: Sensitivity Results in the Down Syndrome Age Subgroups
measure.description: The majority read sensitivity (percentage of DS subjects positive for cerebral beta-amyloid by majority read) was computed for the group of DS subjects with age equal to or below the median age (DS-young) and for DS subjects with age above the median age (DS-old). The median age was 46 yrs, with 3 subjects being exactly 46 yrs old. As defined, these subjects were assigned to the DS-young group.
measure.population: All Down Syndrome subjects (n=39) were analyzed for this outcome.

outcome.title: Quantitative Parameters Standard Uptake Value Ratio
outcome.description: The Standard Uptake Value Ratios for florbetaben signal in the frontal cortex, posterior cingulate, lateral temporal cortex, parietal cortex, and cerebellum (white matter) were determined as a quantitative measure of tracer uptake. The SUV is defined as the ratio of (1) the tissue radioactivity concentration c (in MBq/kg) at time point t, and (2) the injected activity (in MBq, extrapolated to the same time t) divided by the body weight (in kg). These SUV numbers from regions of interest were then used to derive SUV ratios (SUVR) using the SUV from the cerebellar cortex as reference.
outcome.population: All Down Syndrome subjects and healthy volunteers enrolled in the study were included in this analysis

group.title: Down Syndrome Group
group.description: Subjects with Down Syndrome enrolled in the study

group.title: Healthy Volunteer Group
group.description: Healthy volunteers enrolled in the study

measure.title: Quantitative Parameters Standard Uptake Value Ratio
measure.description: The Standard Uptake Value Ratios for florbetaben signal in the frontal cortex, posterior cingulate, lateral temporal cortex, parietal cortex, and cerebellum (white matter) were determined as a quantitative measure of tracer uptake. The SUV is defined as the ratio of (1) the tissue radioactivity concentration c (in MBq/kg) at time point t, and (2) the injected activity (in MBq, extrapolated to the same time t) divided by the body weight (in kg). These SUV numbers from regions of interest were then used to derive SUV ratios (SUVR) using the SUV from the cerebellar cortex as reference.

outcome.title: Consistency Between Visual and Quantitative Efficacy
outcome.description: For a comparison of the results of the visual assessment with the quantitative assessment, descriptive Standardized Uptake Value Ratio (SUVR) statistics were computed separately for DS subjects with an abnormal/normal majority read of the PET scan (DS-PET+/DS-PET-). The SUV is defined as the ratio of (1) the tissue radioactivity concentration c (in MBq/kg) at time point t, and (2) the injected activity (in MBq, extrapolated to the same time t) divided by the body weight (in kg). These SUV numbers from regions of interest were then used to derive SUV ratios (SUVR) using the SUV from the cerebellar cortex as reference.

group.title: Down Syndrome PET-positive (Majority Read)
group.description: Down Syndrome subjects positive for cerebral beta-amyloid as determined by majority read

group.title: Down Syndrome PET-negative (Majority Read)
group.description: Down Syndrome subjects negative for cerebral beta-amyloid as determined by majority read

group.title: Healthy Volunteer Group
group.description: All healthy volunteers enrolled in the study

measure.title: Consistency Between Visual and Quantitative Efficacy
measure.description: For a comparison of the results of the visual assessment with the quantitative assessment, descriptive Standardized Uptake Value Ratio (SUVR) statistics were computed separately for DS subjects with an abnormal/normal majority read of the PET scan (DS-PET+/DS-PET-). The SUV is defined as the ratio of (1) the tissue radioactivity concentration c (in MBq/kg) at time point t, and (2) the injected activity (in MBq, extrapolated to the same time t) divided by the body weight (in kg). These SUV numbers from regions of interest were then used to derive SUV ratios (SUVR) using the SUV from the cerebellar cortex as reference.

reported_events.desc: Adverse event data were collected from Day 1 (baseline) until Day 8 (secondary follow-up visit)

group.title: Down Syndrome Group
group.description: 39 Down Syndrome subjects received Florbetaben (BAY94-9172): 300 MBq single IV injection of 2 to 10 mL

group.title: Healthy Volunteer Group
group.description: 70 healthy volunteer subjects received Florbetaben (BAY94-9172): 300 MBq single IV injection of 2 to 10 mL

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
